Если вы осваиваете корейский язык, то ко: If you are learning Korean, TOPIK (Test of Proficiency in Korean), a special Korean language proficiency test, will be your compass on your educational journey. This certification system was developed back in 1997 by the South Korean government. To this day it is the main one. Most often the test is taken by those who plan to study at universities in South Korea, to find employment in companies in this country or by foreigners applying for permanent residence here.

На сегодняшний день существует два уровн: There are currently two levels of the test: TOPIK I and TOPIK II.
В TOPIK I включены подуровни 1 и 2. Уров: TOPIK I includes sub-levels 1 and 2. The level is called “gyp” (급) in Korean. It is the beginning level of Korean language proficiency. In the TOPIK I test, examinees are tested in two main areas: listening and reading. The tasks must be completed in 100 minutes. These will be multiple-choice questions for listening and reading.
TOPIK II состоит из четырех подуровней (: TOPIK II consists of four sublevels (3 to 6). These are intermediate and advanced levels. On the TOPIK II exam, examinees will have to answer questions from three blocks: listening (50 questions), reading (50 questions) and writing (2 short-answer tasks, 1 graphic description, 1 essay). The time limit for completing the tasks is 180 minutes.
На данном уровне оцениваемый должен умет: At this level, the assessed must be able to compose simple sentences using a vocabulary of up to 800 words. He/she should compose simple monologues and dialogues on the topics “Me and my family”, “Grocery shopping”, “My work”, “My hobbies”, “Weather”, “Transportation”, “How to find the way”, express feelings and opinions in common words. In their speech at this level it is necessary to use: cases, particles, question words, negations, inflection, afterwords, numbers (dates, time, counting words), polite forms, participles, tenses (future, past, continued present), adverbs, conjunctions, particles, expressions of reason, comparative and qualifying constructions, exclamations, etc., etc..
